intro: Hieracium carpathicum subsp. relaxatum, commonly known as the Carpathian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a flowering head composed of yellow disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and forest edges, preferring well-drained soils. It has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in diverse environmental conditions. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
